The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. This is because it directly inserts user input into HTML without properly sanitizing it first. Specifically, the function does not sanitize the 'input.attribu', 'input.preview', 'input.maxSize', 'input._id', and 'input' variables before inserting them into HTML. An attacker could potentially inject malicious scripts through these variables, which would then be executed when the HTML is rendered by a web browser.
